xxl.core.util

Class ObjectPool<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • xxl.core.util.ObjectPool<E>

  • public class ObjectPool<E>
extends Object
    An object pool allows the reuse of unneeded objects by storing them in a pool. The purpose is to avoid garbage collection and recreation of commonly used objects.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected int maxSize
      The maximum number of objects to be stored in the pool.
      protected Stack<E> pool
      The object pool internally realized by a Stack.
      protected Function<Object,E> tupleFactory
      A parameterless function returning a new instance of an arbitrary object.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ObjectPool(Function<Object,E> tupleFactory, int maxSize)
      Constructs a new object pool.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Object getObject()
      Retrieves an object from the pool if available, otherwise the result of tupleFactory.invoke() is returned.
      void releaseObject(E done)
      Delivers an object to the pool.
      void setMaxSize(int newMaxSize)
      Sets the maximum number of objects to be stored in the pool.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • tupleFactory

        protected Function<Object,E> tupleFactory
        A parameterless function returning a new instance of an arbitrary object.

      • maxSize

        protected int maxSize
        The maximum number of objects to be stored in the pool.

      • pool

        protected Stack<E> pool
        The object pool internally realized by a Stack.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ObjectPool

        public ObjectPool(Function<Object,E> tupleFactory,
                  int maxSize)
        Constructs a new object pool.
        Parameters:
        tupleFactory - A parameterless function returning a new instance of an arbitrary object.
        maxSize - The maximum number of objects to be stored in the pool.

    • Method Detail

      • setMaxSize

        public void setMaxSize(int newMaxSize)
        Sets the maximum number of objects to be stored in the pool.
        Parameters:
        newMaxSize - The maximum number of objects to be stored in the pool.

      • getObject

        public Object getObject()
        Retrieves an object from the pool if available, otherwise the result of tupleFactory.invoke() is returned.
        Returns:
        an object from the pool if available, otherwise tupleFactory.invoke().

      • releaseObject

        public void releaseObject(E done)
        Delivers an object to the pool. If the maximum size of the pool is not reached, the object is stored, otherwise it will be dropped.
        Parameters:
        done - The object to be delivered to the pool.
